content.question: The position of a particle moving in the <math alttext="x y"><mi>x</mi><mi>y</mi></math>-plane at time <math alttext="t"><mi>t</mi></math> seconds is given by the vector-valued function <math alttext="p"><mi>p</mi></math> defined by <math alttext="p open parentheses t close parentheses equals open angle brackets x open parentheses t close parentheses comma y open parentheses t close parentheses close angle brackets"><mi>p</mi><mfenced><mi>t</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mfenced close=">" open="<"><mrow><mi>x</mi><mfenced><mi>t</mi></mfenced><mo>,</mo><mi>y</mi><mfenced><mi>t</mi></mfenced></mrow></mfenced></math>. The velocity of the particle is given by the vector-valued function <math alttext="v"><mi>v</mi></math> defined by <math alttext="v open parentheses t close parentheses equals open angle brackets x open parentheses t close parentheses comma y open parentheses t close parentheses close angle brackets"><mi>v</mi><mfenced><mi>t</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mfenced close=">" open="<"><mrow><mi>x</mi><mfenced><mi>t</mi></mfenced><mo>,</mo><mi>y</mi><mfenced><mi>t</mi></mfenced></mrow></mfenced></math>. If <math alttext="p open parentheses 1 close parentheses equals open angle brackets negative 2 comma 4 close angle brackets"><mi>p</mi><mfenced><mn>1</mn></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mfenced close=">" open="<"><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>2</mn><mo>,</mo><mn>4</mn></mrow></mfenced></math> and <math alttext="v open parentheses 1 close parentheses equals open angle brackets 3 comma negative 5 close angle brackets"><mi>v</mi><mfenced><mn>1</mn></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mfenced close=">" open="<"><mrow><mn>3</mn><mo>,</mo><mo>-</mo><mn>5</mn></mrow></mfenced></math>, which of the following is true?

choices.label: At time <math alttext="t equals 1"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn></math> second, the particle is moving right toward the <math alttext="y"><mi>y</mi></math>-axis because the <math alttext="x"><mi>x</mi></math>-component of position is negative and the <math alttext="x"><mi>x</mi></math>-component of velocity is positive.

At time <math alttext="t equals 1"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn></math> second, the particle is moving right toward the <math alttext="y"><mi>y</mi></math>-axis because the <math alttext="x"><mi>x</mi></math>-component of velocity is positive and the <math alttext="y"><mi>y</mi></math>-component of velocity is negative.

At time <math alttext="t equals 1"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn></math> second, the particle is moving left toward the <math alttext="y"><mi>y</mi></math>-axis because the <math alttext="x"><mi>x</mi></math>-component of position is negative and the <math alttext="x"><mi>x</mi></math>-component of velocity is positive.

At time <math alttext="t equals 1"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn></math> second, the particle is moving left toward the <math alttext="y"><mi>y</mi></math>-axis because the <math alttext="x"><mi>x</mi></math>-component of position is negative and the <math alttext="y"><mi>y</mi></math>-component of velocity is negative.

content.answer: At time <math alttext="t equals 1"><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn></math> second, the particle is moving right toward the <math alttext="y"><mi>y</mi></math>-axis because the <math alttext="x"><mi>x</mi></math>-component of position is negative and the <math alttext="x"><mi>x</mi></math>-component of velocity is positive.

unit.text: 4: Functions Involving Parameters, Vectors, and Matrices (Not assessed on the AP Exam)

skill.text: Skill 3.C: Support conclusions or choices with a logical rationale or appropriate data.
